description.narrative: DAP is having a significant developmental impact by supporting a more productive farming business model in Paraguay, which is expected in turn to make significant contribution to Paraguay''s rural economic development as well as to global food security. DAP''s main impacts include: (i) DAP''s innovative approach to establish trust-based relationships with the local peasant communities. DAP''s initiatives help rural families to improve their farming practices, triggering a virtuous circle of development. (ii) DAP is partnering with leading NGOs and local community organizations to develop outreach programs for rural farmers to improve their access to new markets by (a) capacity building on good agricultural practices, (b) advise on product diversification (e.g. organic products), and (c) improve access to roads and logistic services. (iii) DAP has contributed to the development of a new class of agricultural service companies and SMEs agri-contractors in frontier rural areas that provide various services and inputs to the Company. DAP supports indirect employment for 850 persons working for more than 44 SMEs agri-contractors, which DAP promotes through trainings, workshops, and social activities. (iv) DAP contributes to food security by promoting soil conservation agriculture expertise (no-till farming), sustainable pest management (IPM) and world-class farm technology and management, increasing the yields and sustainability of owned and leased farms.

Desarrollo Agricola del Paraguay S.A. (DAP or the Company) is one of the leading farming companies in Paraguay. IFC started its relationship with DAP in 2009 with a short term facility followed by an equity investment to support its operations. DAP currently owns more than 26,000 hectares and leases another 8,000 hectares in Paraguay to cultivate soybean, corn and sunflower with a social-inclusive and sustainable approach. It outsources farming operations to local specialized service providers such as seeding, fertilizing, harvesting, storage, and transportation operators. Desarrollo Agricola del Paraguay LT Financing (the Project) consists of providing a corporate long term facility to DAP for the financing of permanent working capital needs to sustain its farming activities in Paraguay.
